msContents.summary: Homily by Origen written 200-254 in Alexandria, Aegyptus

objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 25x17, 12 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 27 line(s) per column, 37 characters per line, written in Greek.

additions.p: Sheets from a documentary scroll containing a land register, liturgical lists, and corresponce (P. Achmim 6-9 and P. Bouriant 41a-b) on the recto and blank of the verso were cut and glued together back to back to make a new codex. P. Achmim 1 (P. Bouriant 3) and Coptic texts of Exodus and Sirach were written on the blank pages (verso's of the original scroll).

history.provenance: Discovered 1883? by M. Maspero at Dayr Anbā Shanūdah, Miṣr.
[1-4] Purchased by Bouriant 38v, Urbain Bouriant at Al Qāhirah, Miṣr.
[1-4] Transferred to Université Paris-Sorbonne, Institut de Papyrologie (Paris-Sorbonne University, Institute of Papyrology) at Paris, France.
[5] Obtained 1887 by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.
[6-11] Obtained 1887 by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.
[12] Obtained 1887 by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.

msIdentifier.msName: [1-4] 828, Université Paris-Sorbonne, Institut de Papyrologie (Paris-Sorbonne University, Institute of Papyrology), Paris, France.
[5] Copte 135B 17, Suppl. Grec 1099, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.
[6-11] Copte 135A 4,7,9, 135B 1-4,12, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.
[12] Copte 135B 6, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.

sourceDesc.bibl: [1-4] Collart, Paul, “3. Homelie”, Les Papyrus Bouriant, p. 31-37, Honoré Champion: Paris, France, 1926. OCLC 9420157.

[5-12] Collart, Paul, Les papyrus grecs d'Achmîm à la Bibliothèque nationale de Paris, no. 31, p. 33-111, Le Bulletin de l’Institut Français d’Archéologie Orientale: Le Caire, Égypte, 1931. OCLC 3908825.
